repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: An incomplete Rāmāyaṇavācakam, that is, a Tamil prose summary of the Rāmāyaṇa.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (**** 2023).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

support.p: Very good state of preservation, despite some boreholed and truncated leaves.

extent.measure: 177 (U1). f76 missing in the present bundle is found in BnF Indien 288.

collation.desc: the front cover. BnF shelfmark sticker on front cover, recto.
177 folios = Rāmāyaṇavācakam. Tamil foliation 1-41, 54-75, 77-87, 89-129, 132-188, 190-194. 375/390 x 30/40 mm. f56-f57 resized (370 x 30 mm). f92 resized (375 x 35 mm).

additions.desc: BnF current shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 287 (front cover, recto).
Foliation 194 added in black ink on f194r.

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF. 385 x 35 mm. f75-f82 have 3 holes, made before writing.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to circa 1730 by Vinson (in Vinson et al. 1866-) and to 1730 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments).

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 43, n0. 287.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 66r, no. 264 287.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
